intro: Octomeria fialhoensis, commonly known as the Fialho's octomeria, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the wet season. Due to habitat loss, Octomeria fialhoensis is considered threatened and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
